concept.title: File Tail Output
concept.shortdesc: File Tail provides data and related metadata through separate output streams. If you don't need to use the related metadata, you can connect the output stream to a Trash destination.

conbody.p:
File Tail originoutputThe origin passes information thorugh the following output locations:
Data Passes data read from the origin.
Metadata Passes information generated about file processing. To retain this information for review, connect the metadata output location any other destination or route the data as necessary. If you do not require this information, connect the metadata output location to the Trash destination. File processing metadata includes the following fields:
fileName - Name of the file.
inode - Index information for the file.
time - Time that the event occurred.
event - Processing event. START indicates that File Tail started processing the specified file. END indicates that File Tail completed processing the contents of the file.
Inode most reliably identifies a file when a server renames archived files.
